Class Game

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a game session. The Game class manages all key components of the game such as players, game board, card stacks, tile sets, and game level. It allows adding and removing players, and provides access to game-related properties. This class implements Serializable to allow game objects to be persisted or transferred as needed.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int GameLevel, String id) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Game instance with the specified game level and unique identifier. This initializes the game's components, including the card deck, tile deck, game board, and maintains an empty player list.
      Parameters:
      GameLevel - the difficulty level or stage of the game
      id - the unique identifier for this game instance
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs during initialization

  • Method Details

    • NewPlayer

      public void NewPlayer(Player newborn) throws IllegalArgumentException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Adds a new player to the game. This method ensures that the game does not exceed the maximum number of players and prevents duplicate players from being added. If the player is successfully added, their board is set, and they are registered in the game.
      Parameters:
      newborn - The Player object representing the new player to be added. The player's ID must be unique and not already exist in the game.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If a player with the same ID already exists.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the number of players reaches the maximum limit of 4.

    • RemovePlayer

      public void RemovePlayer(String DeadMan)
      Removes a player identified by their unique ID from the game.
      Parameters:
      DeadMan - The unique identifier of the player to be removed.

    • getID

      public String getID()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the game.
      Returns:
      the unique GameID as a String.

    • getPlayers

      public HashMap<String,Player> getPlayers()
      Retrieves all players currently participating in the game session. The returned map contains player identifiers as keys and their corresponding Player objects as values.
      Returns:
      a HashMap containing the mapping of player IDs to Player objects.

    • getGag

      public GAGen getGag()
      Retrieves the GAGen instance associated with the game.
      Returns:
      the GAGen object representing the game's generator, including its tile and card decks.

    • getGameBoard

      public GameBoard getGameBoard()
      Retrieves the game board associated with the current game session.
      Returns:
      the GameBoard instance representing the game board of the session.

    • setGameBoard

      public void setGameBoard(GameBoard gameBoard)
      Updates the game board for the game session with the specified GameBoard object.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - the GameBoard object to set as the current game board for the game session

    • getGameID

      public String getGameID()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the current game instance.
      Returns:
      the unique game identifier as a String

    • setGameID

      public void setGameID(String gameID)
      Sets the game ID for the current game session.
      Parameters:
      gameID - the unique identifier to be set for the game.

    • getLv

      public int getLv()
      Retrieves the current game level.
      Returns:
      the integer representing the level of the game.
